## *Exercise 7*

#### Solve the followings.  


\vspace{15pt}
$$\left(
\begin{array}{cc}
\pi_{1}&\pi_{2}
\end{array}\right)
\left(\begin{array}{cc}
.7&.3 \\
.5&.5
\end{array}\right)
\left(
\begin{array}{cc}
\pi_{1}&\pi_{2}
\end{array}
\right)$$

\begin{center}
$\pi_{1}+\pi_{2}=1$
\end{center}

\vspace{15pt}

(1)
\begin{eqnarray*}
0.7\pi_{1}+0.5\pi_{2}&=&\pi_{1}\\
 \\
0.5\pi_{2}&=&0.3\pi_{1} \\
 \\
\pi_{2}&=&0.6\pi_{1}
\end{eqnarray*}

(2)
\begin{eqnarray*}
\pi_{1}+\pi_{2}=1
\end{eqnarray*}

**From(1) & (2),**
  
  
$\pi_{1}+0.6\pi_{1}=1$  


Thus,  $\pi_{1}=\frac{5}{8}$, $\pi_{2}=\frac{3}{8}$.

## *Exercise 8*

#### Solve the following system of equations.

\begin{eqnarray*}
(1)　　x&=&y \\
 \\
(2)　　y&=&0.5z \\
 \\
(3)　　z&=&0.6-0.4x \\
 \\
(4)　　x+y+z&=&1
\end{eqnarray*}

**From (1) & (2) & (4),**
  
\begin{eqnarray*}
y+y+z&=&1 \\
 \\
2y+z&=&1 \\
 \\
z+z&=&1 \\
 \\
z&=&\frac{1}{2}
\end{eqnarray*}

Thus, $x=\frac{1}{4}, y=\frac{1}{4}, z=\frac{1}{2}$
